alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 06 at 4:10AM AKST until December 07 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulation of 4 to 12 inches. Winds gusting 40 to 60 mph. Visibility as low as one quarter mile at times. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...Until 3 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions expected during and immediately following periods of falling snow, which is expected to be intermittent through Thursday morning. Therefore, there may be periods of higher visibility throughout the event.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
